text:
I feel I see it.   It takes an Absurdist approach by putting an idea to the most logical extreme.

If kids automatically go to heaven, getting them there at any cost should be a devout Christians mission.

Christians profess selflessness, so sacrificing their eternal well-being for their child is the ultimate expression of love and accomplishes the task of getting them (the child) to eternal happiness.

It's a logical conclusion that exposes a loophole into heaven.  A loophole that can't be if an omnipotent, benevolent God were to exist.
